page.title: 11Court Farm,Nympsfield.
page.content: The farm consists of{240 acres.}100 acres of this is arable land,120 acres for grazing and 20 acres of woodland. This farm has 2 barns, 1 old one and 1 new one.The old barn is made from Cotswold stone.The beams in the old barn are probably from a ship because the markings show this.The original tiles were taken off the barn around 1923 and sent to America with others from a farm in Tetbury. In the old barn there are pigeon holes.These holes were blocked up because the structure of the barn was weak.The larger hole was for the owl who kept the mice away. The farm owns a granary.The sacks used to be put onto a rope and then hoisted to the top.Now the grain is screwed up in a large tube and left to dry.There is a mill below the grain store.
